thread.title: 5 Indians in Togo jail to be released soon
thread.title_full: 5 Indians in Togo jail to be released soon

title: 5 Indians in Togo jail to be released soon
text: Sushma Swaraj does it again! 5 Indians in Togo jail to be released soon Sushma Swaraj does it again! 5 Indians in Togo jail to be released soon External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Wednesday said that the release order for all Indian nationals from Kerala, serving prison term in African nation Togo, have been secured. TNN | Feb 1, 2017, 09.47 PM IST External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj (Photo: AP) NEW DELHI: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Wednesday said that the release order for all Indian nationals from Kerala , serving prison term in African nation Togo, have been secured. "We have secured the release of five Indians from Kerala jailed in Togo," Sushma said in a tweet. We have secured the release of 5 Indians from Kerala jailed in Togo. Good work by Indian mission in Accra and Consulate in Togo. â€” Sushma Swaraj (@SushmaSwaraj) February 1, 2017 She also appreciated the efforts of the Indian mission in Accra and Consulate in Togo. In 2016, replying to a question in Rajya Sabha, then Minister of State for External Affairs V K Singh said the Indian nationals from Kerala have been convicted by a Togolese court and government was making efforts to secure their release. "They were arrested in July 2013 for their suspected involvement in a piracy attack off the coast of Togo," he said. The crew, who are employees of a Merchant Navy firm, had set sail for South Africa on October, 2013 from Mumbai. While returning in the month of July, 2014, their ship got stranded in Nigeria and the entire crew was arrested for violating laws of international waters, Singh had informed the Parliament.
